Record.Value: Construction
Practical Training: Stage II
Practical Training: Stage II
Welcome Cadet. Now it's time to test your basic Construction skills.
Collect screwdriver, place in tool belt.
Equip angle grinder in either hand.
Collect drill, place in tool belt.
Practical Training: Stage II.
Go to the crate and pick up your tools.
The walls were 'damaged' by a meteor shower. Before you can replace them, you have to remove the damaged frames using the angle grinder.
Deconstruction
Remove Destroyed frame 1.
Remove Destroyed frame 2.
Construction
Now, finish constructing the base wall.
Build frame in highlighted location.
Complete frames with iron sheets + welder in active hand.
Deconstruction Of The Autolathe.
The last Cadet built the autolathe in the wrong place. Deconstruct it, and rebuild it in the indictated position.
Deconstruct stage 5 of autolathe with the drill.
Deconstruct stage 4 of autolathe with the angle grinder.
Deconstruct stage 3 of autolathe with the wire cutters.
Deconstruct stage 2 of autolathe with the angle grinder.
Deconstruct stage I of autolathe with the wrench.
Construction Of The Autolathe.
Build the autolathe at the new location using the kit and materials from the previous autolathe. The tooltip will provide instructions on the necessary materials.
Place the autolathe kit.
Build stage 2 of autolathe with welder + iron sheets
Build stage 3 of autolathe with cable coil
Build stage 4 of autolathe with welder + plastic sheets
Build stage 5 of autolathe screwdriver
Damanged Wire Removal.
To power up the station, you'll need to reconnect the solar panels to the cable network. Start by removing the damaged cables.
Remove damaged cable #1 with wire cutters
Remove damaged cable #2 with wire cutters
Remove damaged cable #3 with wire cutters
Cable Placement.
Now connect the solar panels to t from cratehe network, with cable from crate. You can cycle through different cable connection types.
Replace missing Heavy straight cable.
Replace missing Heavy junction cable.
Replace missing Heavy straight cable #2.
Backup Power.
You're not finished yet, Cadet! It gets dark sometimes, so let's create a backup power system, using a solid fuel generator.
You'll need to connect the generator to the power network.
Overlay Junction
Use the 'overlay' function to link new cables to an existing network.
Get solid fuel generator kit from crate
Place solid fuel generator
Use wirecutters and cable to create a junction.
Powering Up
The last step is to build and connect an Area Power Control to stablize your electrical flow, and provide back up power.
Get Area Power Controller (APC) from crate.
Place APC in highlighted position with correct orientation.
Now start the generator using coal found in the crate.
Put battery in APC for backup power. If power stops, the battery will provide power to your base for a short time.
Get battery from crate
Get battery from crate
Get coal from crate
Add coal to generator
Turn generator on
Add battery to APC
Now you have solar power and coal generator active. Just turn on the APC to activate the base's power network.
Complete.
Good work, Cadet. You've built a power system. That's the last step of Practical Testing, Phase II. Press the 'Complete' button to transmit your results to Stationeer Command, and we'll move on.
Press button to complete test.
